admreg: Europe and Central Asia,Europe and Central Asia
trustfund:
TF036931-UKRAINE - SOCIAL PROTECTION SUPP.,TF036364-UKRAINE - SOCIAL PROTECTION SUPPORT,TF021995-PHRD-EMPLOYMENT, SOCIAL
            PROTECTION & SERVICES

abstracts.cdata!:
Overall achievement of project
            objectives is assessed as satisfactory while project
            sustainability overall is highly satisfactory. Both World
            Bank and Borrower performances are considered satisfactory
            overall. Lessons learned included the following: Successful
            implementation of the project can be attributed to the fact
            that the Bank and USAID/PADCO (Planning and Development
            Collaborative International) teams worked closely with the
            Ministry on almost all aspects of implementation of the
            housing subsidy program. Although computerization of
            administratiive systems have been introduced as
            free-standing Bank projects, procurement of computers
            without appropriate software and adequate capacity building
            would not have accomplished any of the project objectives.
            Training staff in the use of computer technologies and in
            the management of information exchange was crucial for the
            project's success. Staffing limitations of the Housing
            and Municipal Services Allowance Program (HMSAP) at national
            and regional levels and financing restrictions imposed on
            the Ministry of Labor and Social Policy (MLSP) have not
            allowed them to fully develop information management
            activities that monitor and evaluate programs. For more
            comprehensive projects related to automation of
            administrative systems, the establishment of a formal
            project implementation unit is advisable.
